  • Method Details

    • save_new_contact

      public void save_new_contact(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Adds a contact to the database.
      Has the built-in check for mandatory field, which have to be filled in:
      -Name
      -Surname
      -Company Has a safety feature built-in, which checks if the other fields are empty or not. If they are empty the error is displayed.
      If the field is empty the NULL is sent to database, otherwise the actual input from the field or area is.

    • quit

      public void quit(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Refresh of the contact list is added at the place of opening the "new contact" window

    • connectNow

      private Connection connectNow()

    • checkRequired

      private boolean checkRequired()
      Populates the contact data after a contact is being clicked on.

    • getField

      private void getField(javafx.scene.control.TextField field, int position, PreparedStatement ps) throws SQLException
      Checks if the field that we try to use with SQL query is not empty, if it is we use "setNull" to pass NULL value.
      Otherwise, we use setString, to pass the actual value, input in the field.
      Parameters:
      field - -> field which is being used in SQL query
      position - -> number of element "?", which is being substituted
      ps - -> prepared statement's name
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • getArea

      private void getArea(javafx.scene.control.TextArea area, int position, PreparedStatement ps) throws SQLException
      Checks if the area that we try to use with SQL query is not empty, if it is we use "setNull" to pass NULL value.
      Otherwise, we use setString, to pass the actual value, input in the area.
      Parameters:
      area - -> area which is being used in SQL query;
      position - -> number of element "?", which is being substituted;
      ps - -> prepared statement's name;
      Throws:
      SQLException
